html: Even before the creation of the earth, God had ordained that it would attain a paradisiacal glory (Isaiah 11:6-9; 35:1-2; 51:3; 65:25). This means that at some point the wicked who refuse to repent—the world’s “wild grass” and “weeds”—must perish (Isaiah 10:23; 16:4; 34:1-2; 54:16). Jehovah has appointed the king of Assyria and his alliance of nations to execute the wicked’s destruction (Isaiah 10:5-7; 13:4-12; 21:2; 28:22). As at the Flood in the days of Noah (Genesis 7:23; Isaiah 8:7-8; 54:9), only Jehovah’s righteous people survive into the millennial age (Isaiah 4:2-3; 10:22; 26:2-3; 33:12-24).
